page.title: 18GOVERNMENT IN NETHERBURY
page.content: Local government is Netherbury Parish Council, consisting of 11 members, 5 elected from Netherbury, 3 from Melplash and 3 from Salway Ash. They are unpaid, but there is a clerk appointed by this council who receives a salary amounting to 48% of a penny rate. This produces Â£750. Council must meet at least 4 times each year; in March a special meeting must be called, open to any member of the Parish, to ask questions and speak on local matters. The powers of the Council are very limited, but they are responsible for keeping foot and bridle paths open. All applications for planning consent will be sent to them for comment and this will be taken into account by the Planning Committee of the West Dorset District Council. At present the Electoral Roll for Netherbury contains 310 names
